intro: Dactylaena microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved screw pine, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves around its stem. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Dactylaena microphylla is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to salt spray and sandy soils.
